comments:
The eclipse while startup asks for workspace.
After the workspace selection it crashes.

I have a eclipse installed.
Version: 3.0.2
Build id: 200503110845


What do i need to make the new version of eclipse running.?
Is there any change required for the same.?


The Following is the Log attached.


!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi 4 0 2006-08-08 11:57:59.765
!MESSAGE An error occurred while automatically activating bundle org.eclipse.core.runtime.compatibility (25).
!STACK 0
org.osgi.framework.BundleException: Exception in org.eclipse.core.internal.plugins.CompatibilityActivator.start() of bundle org.eclipse.core.runtime.compatibility.
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleContextImpl.startActivator(BundleContextImpl.java:1012)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleContextImpl.start(BundleContextImpl.java:968)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.BundleHost.startWorker(BundleHost.java:317)
	
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.eventmgr.EventManager$EventThread.run(EventManager.java:291)
Caused by: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/eclipse/core/runtime/Plugin
	at java.lang.Class.getDeclaredMethods0(Native Method)
	at java.lang.Class.privateGetDeclaredMethods(Class.java:1627)
	at java.lang.Class.privateGetPublicMethods(Class.java:1655)
*** Bug 153107 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Not sure to understand what you're trying to do while getting this crash?

I guess you are trying to install a new 3.2 eclipse version on a workspace you worked on with 3.0.2... Then you should not install 3.2 version on top of 3.0.2 one but make a fresh new install. If, for example, your 3.0.2 version was installed on c:\eclipse, then rename this folder eclipse.302 (or delete it) and unzip the eclipse-SDK-3.2-win32.zip to c:\. 

Then, you'll get a brand new install which should work even on a workspace used with previous 3.0.2 version...

Also, it would be better to ask help on this kind of issue on newsgroup instead of opening bugs... Thanks
